title: Linguistic analysis of differences in portrayal of movie characters
authors:
Ramakrishna, Anil  and
Mart{\'i}nez, Victor R.  and
Malandrakis, Nikolaos  and
Singla, Karan  and
Narayanan, Shrikanth
venue: Proceedings of the 55th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (Volume 1: Long Papers)
abstract: We examine differences in portrayal of characters in movies using psycholinguistic and graph theoretic measures computed directly from screenplays. Differences are examined with respect to charactersâ€™ gender, race, age and other metadata. Psycholinguistic metrics are extrapolated to dialogues in movies using a linear regression model built on a set of manually annotated seed words. Interesting patterns are revealed about relationships between genders of production team and the gender ratio of characters. Several correlations are noted between gender, race, age of characters and the linguistic metrics.
